title: [WORK] Ep. 229 The Future of Flexibility at Work with Ellen Kossek
itunes:title: [WORK] Ep. 229 The Future of Flexibility at Work with Ellen Kossek
description:
Ellen Kossek is a Professor at Purdue and a leading US social scientist on work, family, and employment issues. Ellen sheds light on the future of flexibility at work and what that means for the future of your career. 

 

With the great resignation, working from home and major shifts in the workforce, the future may look uncertain. Ellen and Ash talk through how to use this time of change to your career advantage, how to have a flexible career that works specifically for you, and tools to expand your career trajectory while maintaining peace in your personal life.

 

If you want to take advantage of the future and have the flexible career you crave don’t miss this episode!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to thrive in the future of your career during this time of change.
  2. 3 key reasons employers should shift into a more flexible work model- and how you can capitalize on this.
  3. How to collaborate with your coworkers to create working environments that maximize your idea workflow.
  4. Tools to set 
  5. How to get a raise and promotion, even when working remotely.
